means: 朗诵法（指姿态，风度，口才等），发声法

sentence.Network_en: When I was 11 my mother sent me to elocution lessons.
sentence.Network_cn: 在我11岁的时候，妈妈让我去上演说技巧课。

sentence.Network_en: He laid on some elocution lessons, to try to knock the edge off her country accent.
sentence.Network_cn: 他为她安排了几次演讲课, 帮助她克服乡下口音.

sentence.Network_en: With every advantage of lungs and elocution, the effect is vapid.
sentence.Network_cn: 然而,扯着嗓子 、 扬顿挫地朗诵,其结果却是令听者兴味索然.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting oratorical or literary style): from Latin elocutio(n-), from eloqui 'speak out' (see eloquence)

entry.def: Elocution lessons are lessons in which someone is taught to speak clearly and in an accent that is considered to be standard and acceptable.

example.ex: When I was 11 my mother sent me to elocution lessons.
example.tran: 在我11岁的时候，妈妈让我去上演说技巧课。

means.word_mean: 1. an expert manner of speaking involving control of voice and gesture
